course_description: Overview of ecosystem ecology, including dynamics of large scale systems, landscape ecology, ecosystem structure, and function. Topics in the course will include: methods of ecosystem analysis, energy flow, nutrient cycling, community dynamics, issues of scale, models, and ecosystem properties. Fulfills ENVS Intermediate Ecology and Conservation requirement and upper-level lab requirement.
prerequisites: This course requires ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or  BIOL_OX 111 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite OR permission of instructor.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2843, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: C. Keogh, Status: Closed
